issue.body:
## Hello!
<!-- Please leave this section as-is, it's designed to help others in the community know how to interact with our GitHub issues. -->

- Vote on this issue by adding a 👍 reaction
- If you want to implement this feature, comment to let us know (we'll work with you on design, scheduling, etc.)

## Issue details

<!-- Enhancement requests are most helpful when they describe the problem you're having as well as articulating the potential solution you'd like to see built. -->

I am looking to cross-reference already existing API resources from a pulumi dynamic provider resource instances. It would be nice to get the [invoke](https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi/pull/369) functionality available for dynamic providers.

### Affected area/feature

<!-- If you know the specific area where this feature request would go (e.g. Automation API, the Pulumi Service, the Terraform bridge, etc.), feel free to put that area here.  -->

comment.body: @mikhailshilkov As a Pulumi rookie I was confused about the asymmetry of the dynamic providers and regular ones. As you say I could probably use a plain function.

issue.title: Some instrumentation are tagged as a `pre-release` which poses as barrier of entry
issue.body:
**Describe your environment**

python 3.9
pipenv

**Steps to reproduce**

When trying to use some of the instrumentation packages (e.g. opentelemetry-instrumentation-psycopg2) only a [pre-release](https://peps.python.org/pep-0440/#pre-releases) tagged versions are published. This imposes an entry barrier to any pipenv using project because pipenv doesn't allow for per-package pre-release versions which in turn complicates project setup and dependency management configurations.

**What is the expected behavior?**

A NON-pre-release tagged x.y.z versioned packages to be released to avoid hitting package manager related issues and therefore improving usability of the instrumentation packages (e.g. opentelemetry-instrumentation-psycopg2@0.33).

**What is the actual behavior?**

Only a `x.y.zb0` pre-release packages are available (e.g. [opentelemetry-instrumentation-psycopg2@0.32b0](https://pypi.org/project/opentelemetry-instrumentation-psycopg2/0.32b0/)).

**Additional context**

I am aware this is a tooling issue and a [pipenv specific defficiency](https://github.com/pypa/pipenv/issues/1760) but in general I believe it may lower the barrier of entry as pipenv is used quite frequently.
